patterns: What are the bachelor's programs here?
What are the bachelor degree programs here?
What bachelor programs can I study here?
responses:
The following bachelor's programs are taught at FIS VŠE:
• Applied Informatics,
• Data Analytics,
• Information Media and Services< /b>,
• Mathematical methods in economics,
• Multimedia in economic practice.

You can find more information here: https://fis.vse.cz/bakalarske-studium/bakalarske-programy/

patterns: What are the master's programs here?
What follow-up master's programs are there?
responses:
The following master's programs are taught at FIS VŠE:
• Information Management,
• Business Intelligence (IST),
• Data and analytics for business,
• Econometrics and operational research,
• Economic demography,
• Statistics ,
• Business Analysis (IST),
• Cognitive Informatics,
• Business Informatics Management (IST),
• UX Research and Design (IST),
• Information Systems Development (IST),
• Knowledge and Web Technologies,
• Information Systems Management,
• Economic Data Analysis.

You can find more information here: https://fis.vse.cz/magisterske-studium/magisterske-programy/

The following minor specializations are taught at FIS VŠE:
• Analysis of socio-economic data,
• Data engineering,
• Demography and social analysis,
• Econometrics,
• Informatics in business,
• Intelligent systems,
• Communication, interpretation, multimedia,
• Quantitative analysis,
• Quantitative methods for informatics,
• < b>Quantitative methods in management,
• Multimedia communication,
• Insurance engineering,
• Presentation and communication of information ,
• Business Performance Management,
• Security Management.

You can find more information here: https://fis.vse.cz/magisterske-studium/vedlejsi-specializace/

What are the compulsory subjects on the Bachelor's program Multimedia in Economic Practice?
responses:
On the bachelor's program Multimedia in economic practice, the following compulsory subjects are taught:

Multimedia compulsory:
• 3D graphics,
• Communication design ,
• Digital photography,
• Graphics and animation,
• Multimedia project seminar,
• Multimedia technology,
• Computer graphics,
• Practice in multimedia,
• Presentation skills,
• Profession in audiovisual production,
• Audiovisual communication project,
• Advertising agency,
• Multimedia project management (creativity and communication),
• Semiotics of multimedia,
• Creative processing of language and text,
• Introduction to multimedia,
• Web design and user interfaces,
• Basics of audiovisual communication,
• Basics of digital photography,
• Basics of computer graphics, < br>• Sound and multimedia.

Economically compulsory:
•Copyright and industrial property,
• Questionnaire survey – mini-project,
• Economics I, < br>• Management for informatics and statistics,
• Marketing 1,
• Mathematics for economists,
• Personal financial planning (alternatively company finance).
• Business and law,
• Statistics (alternatively Description, visualization and comparison of economic data for Multimedia),
• Accounting and taxes of an individual entrepreneur.

You can find more information here: https://fis .vse.cz/baccalarske-studium/baccalarske-programy/program-multimedia-v-ekonomicke-praxi/

patterns: What are the required subjects in the Bachelor of Data Analytics program?
responses:
The following compulsory subjects are taught on the bachelor's program Data Analytics:

Informatics compulsory:
• Data mining in the cloud,
• Database,
• Data quality,
• Data minimum,
• External data and information sources,
• Tools for data analytics,
• Neural networks and deep learning,
• Principles of digital communication ,
• Data Project Management,
• Machine Learning 1,
• Machine Learning 2,
• Text Analytics 1,
• Text Analytics 2,
• Introduction to Language Programming Python,
• Introduction to programming in R,
• Basics of Business Intelligence,
• Big Data processing

Quantitatively mandatory:
• Description, visualization and comparison of economic data,
• Econometric models,
• Exploratory data analysis,
• Mathematical informatics,
• Mathematical statistics,
• Mathematics for informatics,
• Optimization models, < br>• Probability and random processes,
• Surveys and questionnaires, Regression models.

Economics compulsory:
• Banking and financial institutions,
• Economics 1,
• Critical and analytical thinking,
• Presentation and storytelling; Accounting I.,
• Basics of information ethics and law,
• Basics of marketing for informatics and statistics,
• Basics of professional work.

You can find more information here: https://fis.vse.cz/ bachelor's-study/bachelor-programs/program-data-analytics/

What are the compulsory subjects on the Bachelor's program Mathematical Methods in Economics?
responses:
On the bachelor's program Mathematical methods in economics, the following compulsory subjects are taught:

Quantitative compulsory:
• Demographic projections,
• Mathematics 2 ,
• Methods of statistical comparison,
• Operational research models,
• Statistical methods 1,
• Stochastic models,
• Introduction to programming in R,
• Introduction to probability theory and mathematical statistics,
• Fundamentals of data analysis,
• Fundamentals of demography.

Economics compulsory:
• Economics 1,
• Financial theory, politics and institutions,
• Informatics for statistics,
• Management for informatics and statistics,
• Mathematics for economists,
• Law; Accounting I.,
• Basics of marketing for informatics and statistics.

Other compulsory subjects differ depending on the chosen specialization.

You can find more information here: https://fis.vse.cz/bakalarske-studium/bakalarske-programy/program-matematicke-metody-v-ekonomii/

patterns: What do they have to eat in the canteen today?
What do they have for lunch?
responses:
Today in the canteen is:
• Handful with vegetables1,
• Grilled chicken breast, baked potatoes, Roquefort dip
• Pilsner pork stew sprinkled with onions, bread dumplings / steamed rice
• Minced meat pepperoni , potato chips, mustard, onions

patterns: Who is the dean of FIS
Who is the dean of the Faculty of Informatics and Statistics
responses: The Faculty of Informatics and Statistics is headed by the dean prof. Ing. Jakub Fischer, Ph.D. the vice-dean for study and teaching activities is Ing. Kristýna Vltavská, Ph.D . Ing. Dušan Chlapek, Ph.D. is the vice-dean for creative activity and foreign relations and at the same time the statutory representative of the dean. b> holds the position of vice dean for development, knowledge transfer and cooperation with practice.The academic director of foreign language study programs is doc. Ing. Petr Mazouch, Ph.D. The manager of communication and marketing is Ing. Zdeněk Vondra, Ph.D. The secretary of the faculty is Ing. Marie Gvoždiaková.

patterns: I want to learn more about FIS
responses: You can learn more about the faculty in the short documentary movie About numbers and people: https:// www.youtube.com/watch?v=X-ao_V4fGpE

patterns: Consultation hours of the study department
Consultation hours of the study department
Official hours of the study department
Official hours of the study department
responses:
The study department has office hours on Mondays from 8:30 am to 11:30 am and from 1:00 pm to 3:00 pm and on Wednesdays from 8:30 am to 11:30 am and from 1:00 pm to 3:00 pm.
• Ing. Jana Sedláčková is responsible for bachelor studies and the InSIS contact center.
• Jana Hudčeková is responsible for bachelor studies and has her office in room 410 NB. Her telephone the number is 224 095 440 and the e-mail address is jana.hudcekova@vse.cz.
• Iva Hudcová is in charge of master's studies and her room is 409 NB. You can contact her at the phone number 224 095 487 or e-mail address hudcovai@vse.cz.
• Ing. Tereza Krajíčková, DiS. is responsible for doctoral studies and her office is located in room 412 NB.She can be contacted via the telephone number 224 095 464 or the e-mail address tereza.krajickova@vse.cz

patterns: Until when do I have to submit an application for studies
responses:
Submission of the application for the academic year 2023/2024, including crediting the payment to the account, must take place no later than 30/04/2023 You can find more information here:
• Bachelor's studies: https://fis.vse.cz/bakalarske-studium/prijimaci-rizeni/
• Master's degree: https://fis.vse.cz/magisterske-studium/prijimaci-rizeni/
• Doctoral studies: https://fis.vse.cz/doktorske -study/admissions-management/

patterns: How much does it cost to submit an application for studies
How much does an application cost
responses: The fee for actions connected with the admission procedure amounts to CZK 880 and can be paid either immediately when entering the application by payment card, or by bank transfer (the applicant will receive the account number and variable symbol to the e-mail address specified in the application ). The payment must be credited to the VŠE account by April 30, 2023 at the latest.
Innovation week always takes place in the 7th semester of classes.

patterns: How many credits are required to complete the program?
Number of credits required to complete the program
responses: To successfully complete studies at VSE, you need to obtain at least 180 credits for bachelor's programs and 120 credits for master's programs.

patterns: How many reserved credits do I have?
How many credits can I lose?
How many credits can I lose?
responses: The number of reserve credits/vouchers for bachelor's programs is 36, for master's programs 24.

patterns: When is the VSE library open?
Where is the VSE library located?
responses:
The VŠE library offers students, employees and the professional public printed and electronic resources, provides consultations, organizes publicly accessible seminars focused on working with information and participates in the teaching of some subjects.
• The library is located on the VŠE campus in Žižkov - mezzanine Staré buildings, náměstí W. Churchilla 4, Prague 3.
• Opening hours: Monday – Thursday from 9:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. and on Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.

patterns: What are the scholarships at VSE?
responses: At VŠE, it is possible to get an accommodation scholarship for students who do not have a permanent residence in Prague. There is also the possibility to get a merit-based scholarship. The conditions for obtaining it differ from each faculty.

patterns: Does VSE offer accommodation in dormitories?
responses: VŠE offers accommodation in dormitories. Specifically Palach's college, University Hotel, Eisler's college and Thaler's college, which located in Prague 3. Also Rooseveltova kolej in Holešovice and Blanice and Vltava colleges in Jižní Město, which are mainly intended for first-year undergraduate students .

Alumni a Corporate Relations tvoří čtyri centra:
• Kariérní centrum, Eventové centrum, Absolventské centrum a Partnerské centrum.
V rámci činnosti poskytuje kvalitní servis českým i zahraničním studentům, absolventům, zaměstancům i partnerům VŠE především v oblastech kariéry, poradenství, event managementu, vztahu s absolventy a partnery VŠE.
Systematicky rozvíjí vztahy s praxí, podobnými pracovišti v České republice i v zahraničí. Jejich služby jsou k dispozici aktérům uvnitř školy i firemním partnerům.

The DAB Alumni Club is a community for (future) data specialists who met while studying data analytics. The club is organized by students for current and former student colleagues with the support of department heads and program sponsors. Members are students or graduates of the Bachelor's program Data Analytics or Master's of the Data and Analytics for Business program taught at VŠE. Link to Facebook group: <a href='https://www.facebook.com/groups/2367392286732156'>https://www.facebook.com/groups/2367392286732156</ and>
